alert.note: Alert for Hickory; Laclede; Maries; Phelps; Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 1:48PM CDT until May 21 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Camden, Hickory, Maries and Pulaski. In east central Missouri, Phelps. In southwest Missouri, Laclede, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 148 PM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Osage Fork at Auburn Road, Wet Glaize at Carrol Cave Road, Elk Creek at Highway Z, Dry Auglaize Creek at Freedom Ridge Road and Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Leonard Wood, Lebanon, Waynesville, Camdenton, St. Robert, Richland, Dixon and Crocker. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
